{{wikipedia|Lake Dian}}
{{wikipedia|Chinese provincial abbreviations}}

===Etymology===
A [[phonosemantic]] compound of Chinese semantic [[氵]] ("[[water]]") + phonetic [[真]] (''[[zhēn]]'', reconstructed Old Chinese ''*tin''<!--Baxter-->)

===Han character===
{{Han char|rn=85|rad=水|as=10|sn=13|four=34181|canj=EJBC}}

# [[Lake Dian]] near [[Kunming]], [[Yunnan]], in [[China]]
# {{lb|cmn|abbreviation}} [[Yunnan]] [[province]]

====Usage notes====
The abbreviation may also include [[Guizhou]] Province, as it was united with the area before 1413.<ref name="henrywanhoichan20130908">{{cite-web|url=http://the-sun.on.cc/cnt/lifestyle/20130908/00636_001.html|title=雲上旅程：找到沈萬三的墓|trans_title=Journey on cloud: Tomb of Samman SHEN discovered|date=2013-09-08|work=Henry WanHoi CHAN (陳雲海)|publisher=Oriental Daily (東方日報)|location=Hong Kong|language=Chinese|archiveurl= |archivedate= |accessdate=2013-09-09}}</ref>
